Package ru.ashemchuk.expression

Class Sub

java.lang.Object
ru.ashemchuk.expression.Expression
ru.ashemchuk.expression.Sub
public class Sub extends Expression
Represents a subtraction operation between two expressions. This class extends Expression to provide functionality for subtracting two terms.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    Sub(Expression t1, Expression t2)
    Constructs a new Sub expression with the specified terms.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sub

      public Sub(Expression t1, Expression t2)
      Constructs a new Sub expression with the specified terms.
      Parameters:
      t1 - the minuend (left operand) of the subtraction
      t2 - the subtrahend (right operand) of the subtraction

  • Method Details

    • derivative

      public Expression derivative(String var)
      Computes the derivative of the subtraction expression. The derivative of a difference is the difference of the derivatives.
      Specified by:
      derivative in class Expression
      Parameters:
      var - the variable with respect to which to differentiate
      Returns:
      a new Sub expression representing the derivative

    • eval

      public Expression eval(String signification)
      Evaluates the subtraction expression by evaluating both terms with the given signification.
      Specified by:
      eval in class Expression
      Parameters:
      signification - the variable signification to use for evaluation
      Returns:
      a new Sub expression with evaluated terms

    • simplify

      public Expression simplify()
      Simplifies the subtraction expression by applying mathematical rules. If both terms are equal, returns zero. If both terms are numbers, returns their difference. Otherwise, returns a new Sub expression with simplified terms.
      Specified by:
      simplify in class Expression
      Returns:
      a simplified expression according to subtraction rules

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the subtraction expression. The terms are enclosed in parentheses and separated by a minus sign.
      Specified by:
      toString in class Expression
      Returns:
      a string representation of the form "(term1 - term2)"

    • getLeft

      public Expression getLeft()
      Returns the left term (minuend) of the subtraction expression.
      Returns:
      the minuend (left operand)

    • getRight

      public Expression getRight()
      Returns the right term (subtrahend) of the subtraction expression.
      Returns:
      the subtrahend (right operand)
